image.altText: A mother sheep and two lambs in an open paddock

props.synopsis: The English Leicester makes no money on the farm's profit and loss sheet, but some farmers are passionate about the breed and its long, lustrous fleece.

title.children: Tasmanian farmers keep a rare sheep breed that makes no sense or cents

image.altText: Gerard Dezoete wears a suit and tie and dark sunglasses and looks at the camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Experienced tradesman Gerard Dezoete died after falling from a scissor lift on a construction site in central Launceston in 2020. The company contracting him has been cleared of all but one safety breach.

title.children: Man killed in fall from scissor lift had 'mental lapse': Magistrate

image.altText: Wind turbines black and white.

props.synopsis: International energy companies are reconsidering their investments in Australian offshore wind projects as the Trump administration's disruption of the industry causes global uncertainty.

title.children: Energy giant drops offshore wind project amid global 'headwinds'

image.altText: Photos of a prepolling centre for a state election.

props.synopsis: Tasmania leads the country in casting informal votes — here's how to make sure your ballot paper counts on July 19.

title.children: How to make your vote count at the Tasmanian election

image.altText: hand puts a ballot into a voting ballot box

props.synopsis: Where can I vote? Can I take a selfie while doing it? Who are the candidates? All your questions about the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Your questions about Tasmania's election answered

image.altText: Woman in beanie and coat sits on park bench

props.synopsis: Amelia Bird would love to become a home-owner in Tasmania, but she isn't hopeful. Like many others, she is looking at what is being promised at this month's state election for people who want a place of their own.

title.children: These Tasmanians want to see housing as the number one priority this election

image.altText: A tree burning.

props.synopsis: Sewage spills, polluted rivers, endangered plants and animals facing risk, fragmented landscapes – Tasmania has a long list of environmental problems. But neither major party appears willing to address it this election.

title.children: Environmental outlooks flagged, but issue sidelined in election campaign

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing, to the stadium.

title.children: What are Tasmanians being promised at their state election?

image.altText: Marla Maples.

props.synopsis: Marla Maples reveals the role she played in bringing the US president and Robert F Kennedy Jr into a powerful political alliance.

title.children: She was married to Trump, now she's helping rewrite America's health system

image.altText: Illustration of a smashed piggy bank leaking coins, with a hammer in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Welfare for the wealthy. The battle over superannuation reform.

title.children: Who's a dole bludger now? Why our wealthy are fighting to retain a super rort

image.altText: Mark Latham sat down wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: New South Wales MP Mark Latham denies the allegations of abuse, made by his former partner, as "comically false and ridiculous".

title.children: Mark Latham denies ex-partner's allegations of domestic abuse and 'degrading' sex acts

image.altText: A brain on a tray in a lab.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists find the first evidence of an unusual pattern of brain scarring only seen in people repeatedly exposed to blast waves.

title.children: Brain injury of Australian soldier matches that of dead US Navy SEALs

image.altText: A little corella looks down from a gum tree

props.synopsis: Hundreds of native corellas and pigeons are found dead in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Hundreds of birds die in Melbourne following suspected poisoning

image.altText: A young man with curly hair and a vacant stare.

props.synopsis: Known for playing hard-partying keyboardist Viv Savage in Rob Reiner's 1984 cult classic This Is Spinal Tap, Kaff is being remembered by his bandmates as a "dear brother" with a "kind word and a quick wit".

title.children: Spinal Tap keyboardist David Kaff dies 'peacefully in his sleep'

image.altText: West Indies batter Mikyle Louis completes his swing as the cricket ball hits his stumps.

props.synopsis: Former West Indies captain Carl Hooper calls for heads to roll and World Cup hero Carlos Brathwaite labels the team "abysmal" after the team's record 3-0 loss to Australia.

title.children: Abysmal, unfair, angry and upset: Aussies leave West Indies cricket in tatters

image.altText: A woman surrounded by other pro-independence demonstrators holds up a Kanak flag behind her back.

props.synopsis: Observers say regardless of the enthusiasm of French President Emmanuel Macron, the deal faces a long and uncertain path before it can take effect. So, how did it get to this point, and what needs to happen for it to take effect?

title.children: France has agreed to create a new 'state' near Australia. What does it mean?

image.altText: A drone image of Chevron's Gorgon project on Barrow Island.

props.synopsis: Chevron confirms gas from some closed oil wells on Barrow Island is contaminating the area's surface and groundwater.

title.children: Scrutiny on energy industry after Chevron confirms gas leak

image.altText: Three people stand on grass near a lake.

props.synopsis: The child's mother pulled the boy out of a lake near their campsite on the weekend. A post-mortem has been conducted, but police are waiting for additional results as the investigation continues.

title.children: Police wait for test results after Queensland baby's mysterious death

image.altText: Jase Burgoyne gets a handball away

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide's general manager says the references to sexual violence contained in racist messages to a Power player over the weekend have taken toxic trolling to "another level" — and he has also expressed concern that sports betting is exacerbating vitriol against players.

title.children: Power condemns 'vile' sexual violence threat contained in racist messages

image.altText: Angry young asian woman checking laptop in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: If you're waiting for the 20 per cent cut to your HECS debt the government promised, you may have noticed when logging in to the ATO website that it's actually increased. We asked tax and finance experts to help clear up the confusion.

title.children: Why has my HECS-HELP debt increased?

image.altText: A young solider.

props.synopsis: Private Richard Norden has received the Victoria Cross for bravery in the face of enemy fire, 57 years after his death.

title.children: Soldier receives Australia's highest military honour 53 years after death

image.altText: A person taps a black credit or debit card on a payment terminal.

props.synopsis: The central bank wants to end surcharging on eftpos, Mastercard and Visa cards from next July, following a review finding the system is outdated and retailers are charging blanket surcharges regardless of card type.

title.children: RBA wants to end card surcharges and save users $1.2b a year

image.altText: housing minister Clare O'Neil speaking at press conference with Prime Minister anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Labor has been given several policy options to expand on its housing agenda after Jim Chalmers acknowledged yesterday its signature target was not on track.

title.children: Support payment for renters on Treasury's housing options list

image.altText: A sign emblazoned with the BHP logo, reflecting the orange light of a sunrise.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's iron ore industry is on alert after the confirmation of a measles case on a BHP mine site in the Pilbara.

title.children: Measles case confirmed for major iron ore miner

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a plastic spatula above a petri dish with bacteria inside.

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says the latest death occurred in the Cairns and Hinterland region in the past seven days.

title.children: New melioidosis death brings this year's Queensland fatalities to 35

image.altText: Several people holding down a teenage boy in an aeroplane

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy is being assessed for a neurological condition after allegedly attempting to hijack a Jetstar plane at a major Victorian regional airport, a court hears.

title.children: Teen to undergo neurological exam after alleged plane hijack attempt

image.altText: Nestory Irankundra runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic is playing the waiting game with teen sensation Nestory Irankunda, who is set for a move from Bayern Munich to Watford.

title.children: Socceroos door open for Irankunda as English move looms

image.altText: Two men stand in front of a backdrop of flowers wearing traditional Indian dress.

props.synopsis: Roshan Sethi's charmer puts a queer twist on rom-com tropes for a fun and ultra-romantic film with a surprising tenderness.

title.children: True rom-coms are rare. A Nice Indian Boy doesn't hold back

image.altText: A black car with a smashed windscreen

props.synopsis: A teenage girl is critically injured after a car cruise event in Perth, prompting local car enthusiasts to rally together to denounce hoon behaviour.

title.children: Teenage girl critically injured after Perth car cruise event

image.altText: A house, with police tape and the rear of a police vehicle

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old man is sent to prison for his involvement in a "senseless and tragic" fatal shooting during a botched robbery in Central West New South Wales in 2021.

title.children: Man jailed for 12 years over murder during 'shambolic' failed robbery

image.altText: a long stretch of blue hallway in a sterile, brightly lit warehouse

props.synopsis: Documents show Greater Western Water is assessing 19 data centre applications requesting to use a total of 20 gigalitres of water annually — the same amount 330,000 Melburnians used in the last financial year.

title.children: Data centres bid to guzzle enough drinking water for 330,000 people

image.altText: Tristan Xerri is confronted by Max Gawn

props.synopsis: North Melbourne confirm they will take Tristan Xerri's three-match striking ban to the AFL tribunal, with Adam Cerra and Zac Bailey also up on a big night.

title.children: Tristan Xerri to challenge three-week ban at tribunal

image.altText: Beyonce tips a black cowboy hat, wears shiny black long white blonde hair, nails long, background blurred.

props.synopsis: Hard drives were among items stolen from a rental car in Atlanta days before the singer's four-night tour stop in the city, according to a police report.

title.children: Unreleased Beyoncé music stolen during Cowboy Carter tour

image.altText: Former Australian golfer Karrie Webb smiles while wearing a cap.

props.synopsis: The legendary Karrie Webb is being credited as the key to golf's golden generation as Australian women dominate on the world stage like never before.

title.children: Webb weaves magic to usher in Aussie golf's golden generation

image.altText: A man in glasses and a suit outside glass doors

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer injured in a shooting which killed Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig in 2023 has recounted the moment he held his dying colleague in his arms. Another officer shared her guilt for unknowingly leading her colleagues into "a nightmare".

title.children: Police officer describes moment he held dying colleague in his arms after ambush
